secondHero.subtitle: Digital transformations in the Overijsselse nature
secondHero.description: Imagine: a forest walk, the rustling of leaves and singing birds. For people with dementia such a nature experience can mean a lot. Virtual Walking brings this experience close, right from home or a care facility. It offers peace, relaxation and recognition.

testimonials.title: Volunteers
testimonials.subtitle: Why we participate
items: Virtueel Wandelen brings the nature to life with soothing nature walk videos for the elderly and people with dementia.
Offering a beautiful walking experience does me good
I would like everyone to experience what walking can bring you, peace, space, inspiration, connection. Virtual Walking... is such a great way to do that. I therefore join it with enthusiasm

What I hope to get out of my volunteer work at Virtual Walking is mainly connection and meaning. I would like to... do something that really matters to others, in this case to people who can no longer walk themselves, but can still feel, experience and enjoy. In addition, it gives me satisfaction to combine my love for hiking and nature with my desire to contribute to the well-being of others. The idea that someone else can view a walk at a later time is really a great find!
I am a nurse and come into contact with people with dementia at work. I also walk a lot in my spare time.
Nice combination of walking, doing useful work that makes people happy.
My hobbies are photography/video and walking. In addition, I think it is important to do volunteer work that... really makes sense.
Making beautiful images makes me very happy. Furthermore, walking is fun and good for your health...
A smile on someone else's face is enough.
I love walking and photography/filming and I like to share that with others
I already like to walk and this is a nice combination between being physically active and doing something useful
Perfect for people who can no longer walk, but still want to enjoy nature.

noReviews.title: No reviews available for this video

questions.question: What is Virtual Walking?
questions.answer: Virtual Walking is an innovative platform that provides immersive virtual reality experiences of walking through various scenic locations, designed to promote relaxation and mental well-being.

questions.question: Who is Virtual Walking for?
questions.answer: Virtual Walking is suitable for anyone looking to relax, reduce stress, or experience the benefits of walking without physical exertion. It's particularly beneficial for individuals with mobility challenges, the elderly, or those seeking mindfulness practices.

questions.question: Are the videos and sounds calming?
questions.answer: Yes, all Virtual Walking videos feature soothing visuals and calming soundscapes, including gentle nature sounds, soft music, and ambient audio to enhance the relaxation experience.

questions.question: Is it suitable for people in an advanced stage of dementia?
questions.answer: Virtual Walking can be beneficial for individuals with dementia, as it provides familiar and comforting environments. However, it's recommended to consult with healthcare professionals for personalized suitability.

questions.question: Can I choose walks by theme or location?
questions.answer: Absolutely! Virtual Walking offers a wide variety of walks categorized by themes (e.g., forest, beach, mountain) and specific locations from around the world, allowing you to choose based on your preferences.

tinaSection.title: Tina - Founder of Virtual Walking.
tinaSection.quote: "Together â€“ with informal caregivers, care organizations and volunteers â€“ we bring nature to life for everyone who can no longer visit it themselves."

ourApproach.title: Making Nature Accessible, Anywhere
ourApproach.description1: Virtual Walking opens the door to nature for everyone â€” regardless of physical limitations. Through authentic, real-life walking videos, we bring the beauty, peace, and familiarity of local landscapes to people who may no longer be able to experience them in person.
ourApproach.description2: From seniors with dementia to those with limited mobility, our videos bring calm, spark recognition, and support well-being â€” strengthening connections with the world and with oneself.
ourApproach.description3: Virtual Walking brings the power of experiencing nature to people with limited mobility by showcasing real nature videos from the neighborhood. With authentic, carefully curated footage, we create relaxation, connection, and a positive impact on well-being and health. Our goal is to make nature accessible to everyone, strengthening their connection with themselves and potentially the outside world.

partnersSection.title: Our Collaborating Partners
partnersSection.subtitle: Working together to bring nature closer to everyone.
partnersSection.partner1Text: We work together with 10 Natuurlijk to encourage physical outdoor experiences and greening in healthcare.
partnersSection.partner2Text: This foundation is dedicated to creating documentaries, films, and documents with social utility and/or impact, as well as preserving intangible heritage for future generations. Volunteers who enjoy making videos for this platform are given access to a camera through the foundation.

benefits: Brings nature safely indoors - gives people the chance to enjoy nature without risks, especially for those unable to walk outside.
Stimulates memories - familiar sounds and views can trigger recognition and joyful moments.
Encourages social connection - creates shared experiences with family, caregivers, or fellow residents â€” and can also be enjoyed alone.
Reduces anxiety and stress - soothing natural sights and sounds help ease restlessness and bring calm.

faqs.question: What kind of music is used with the videos?
faqs.answer: The basis of the videos are the sounds that occur at the moment you film: the wind through the trees, rippling water, geese flying overhead, your footsteps on the ground... What we want to add is the option to choose music when playing the video so that people have the option to turn on music that they like. So that will be an extra option that can be chosen personally.

faqs.question: How are the recordings edited?
faqs.answer: We work with an editor who edits the videos. This removes annoying noises or unpleasant images (for example, a too fast turn). The videos are played at the pace that is being walked, so no slower or faster. The pieces of video flow smoothly into each other (one clip fades while the other comes into view) so that there are quiet transitions and it is experienced as pleasant.

faqs.question: Do I have to film everything in 1 go?
faqs.answer: No, as soon as you have started filming and you want to stop for whatever reason (rest on a bench yourself, or blow your nose for example) you can stop the recording. If you want to continue, turn the camera back on and continue your walk. The editor puts the videos together. So you can also take a break in between if necessary.

faqs.question: I would like to learn more about dementia, to delve into the target group, is that possible?
faqs.answer: Yes, there are websites that give you more information about the number 1 national disease: Dementia. For more information, visit www.alzheimer-nederland.nl or www.samendementievriendelijk.nl

header.title: Nature Stories
header.subtitle: Stories and insights that bring nature closer to everyone

posts.powerOfWalking: The Power of Walking in Nature
posts.natureBenefits: Nature's Benefits for Body and Mind

content.main: Nature has always been more than just a backdrop to our lives. It is the air we breathe, the water we drink, and the ground we walk on. Yet, in our fast-paced world, it's easy to forget the powerful role that nature plays in our physical, emotional, and social well-being. Spending time outdoorsâ€”even for a short walkâ€”has been proven to reduce stress, lower blood pressure, and improve concentration. For children, nature inspires curiosity, imagination, and play. For older adults, it awakens memories and creates moments of calm and recognition. But nature's importance goes beyond individual health. It connects us. Shared experiences in a park, forest, or garden bring families, friends, and even communities closer. In this sense, nature is both a healer and a unifier.
content.subtitle: Why it matters now:
benefits: ðŸŒ± Mental health boost â€“ Green spaces reduce anxiety and increase happiness.
ðŸŒž Physical health â€“ Regular exposure to fresh air and sunlight strengthens immunity and improves sleep.
ðŸŒ A deeper bond â€“ Connecting with nature nurtures a sense of belonging and care for the planet.
When we choose to slow down and embrace natureâ€”even in small ways, like listening to birdsong or feeling the grass under our feetâ€”we remind ourselves that we are part of something larger.
âœ¨ Nature isn't just "out there." It's part of who we are.

powerOfWalking.title: The Power of Walking in Nature

content.main: Walking in nature is more than just exerciseâ€”it's a transformative experience that nourishes both body and soul. Each step on natural paths connects us to the rhythms of the earth, offering a respite from the digital noise of modern life. Scientific research consistently shows that walking in natural environments reduces stress hormones, boosts mood-enhancing neurotransmitters, and improves cognitive function. The gentle movement, fresh air, and scenic beauty combine to create a powerful healing effect that no gym workout can replicate.
content.subtitle: The transformative benefits of nature walks:
benefits: ðŸ§  Enhanced brain function â€“ Nature walks improve focus, creativity, and problem-solving abilities.
ðŸ’š Cardiovascular health â€“ Regular walking strengthens the heart and improves circulation.
ðŸŒ¿ Stress reduction â€“ Natural environments lower cortisol levels and promote relaxation.
ðŸ‘¥ Social connection â€“ Walking with others builds stronger relationships and community bonds.
ðŸŒ„ Mindfulness practice â€“ Each step becomes a meditation, bringing us into the present moment.
ðŸƒâ€â™‚ï¸ Sustainable fitness â€“ Nature walking is gentle on joints while providing comprehensive health benefits.

content.main: The connection between nature and human well-being is profound and well-documented. Modern research confirms what ancient wisdom has always known: spending time in nature is essential for our physical and mental health. From reducing inflammation and boosting immune function to improving sleep quality and emotional resilience, nature offers a holistic approach to wellness that complements modern medicine. The natural world's rhythmsâ€”seasons changing, tides rising and falling, birds migratingâ€”remind us of our place in the larger ecosystem and provide a sense of peace and perspective that urban environments often lack.
content.subtitle: Nature's gifts for body and mind:
benefits: ðŸ’Š Natural healing â€“ Green environments accelerate recovery and reduce chronic disease risk.
ðŸ˜Š Emotional balance â€“ Nature exposure regulates mood and reduces symptoms of depression and anxiety.
ðŸ›Œ Better sleep â€“ Natural light patterns and evening walks improve sleep quality and duration.
ðŸ§˜ Mental clarity â€“ Time in nature enhances focus, memory, and cognitive performance.
â¤ï¸ Heart health â€“ Outdoor activities strengthen cardiovascular function and reduce blood pressure.
ðŸŒ± Immune support â€“ Fresh air and natural compounds boost immune system effectiveness.

natureBenefits.title: Nature's Benefits for Body and Mind

content.main: Our bodies and minds are intricately designed to thrive in natural environments. The human nervous system evolved in harmony with nature's patternsâ€”rhythmic sounds of water, gentle breezes, dappled sunlight through leaves. When we disconnect from these natural stimuli, our stress response systems remain chronically activated, leading to a cascade of health issues. Reconnecting with nature recalibrates our biology, reducing cortisol levels, improving heart rate variability, and enhancing immune function. Every cell in our body responds to the healing frequencies of nature, from the electromagnetic fields of the earth to the negative ions in fresh air.
content.subtitle: The science-backed benefits of nature connection:
benefits: ðŸ§¬ Cellular repair â€“ Nature exposure activates DNA repair mechanisms and reduces oxidative stress.
ðŸ¦‹ Nervous system reset â€“ Natural environments restore autonomic nervous system balance.
ðŸŒŠ Hormonal harmony â€“ Time outdoors regulates cortisol, melatonin, and serotonin production.
ðŸ«€ Cardiovascular optimization â€“ Nature walks improve endothelial function and blood flow.
ðŸ§  Neuroplasticity boost â€“ Natural settings enhance brain connectivity and cognitive reserve.
ðŸ›¡ï¸ Immune modulation â€“ Forest bathing and nature exposure strengthen immune regulation.

volunteerHowItWorks.heroTitle: How to help as a Volunteer
volunteerHowItWorks.heroSubtitle: Bring nature to those who can't walk
volunteerHowItWorks.heroDescription: Record or upload videos of nature and share them with clients. Ask questions or leave a message anytime!
volunteerHowItWorks.cameraGuideTitle: How does the camera work again?
volunteerHowItWorks.cameraGuideDescription: Want to create nature videos for Virtual Walking? We offer training sessions where you'll learn step by step how to use the camera, along with practical tips to make filming as easy as possible. We recommend joining a training first before you get started. Need a refresher afterwards on how to use the camera? You'll find everything you need on the dedicated instruction page.
volunteerHowItWorks.cameraUsageDescription: By pressing the information icons you get a refresher on how to use the camera.
volunteerHowItWorks.tipsTitle: More tips for you as a volunteer
volunteerHowItWorks.tipsDescription: With these extra tips you ensure a pleasant experience for the viewer and yourself.
volunteerHowItWorks.tip1: Take your supplies: selfie stick, camera protective case, lens protector.
volunteerHowItWorks.tip2: Breathing: don't pant into the camera, don't make sounds.
volunteerHowItWorks.tip3: If you want to focus, you have to get very close to it.
volunteerHowItWorks.tip4: During sunrise there is beautiful light outside, this is the ideal time to go out.
volunteerHowItWorks.tip5: Clothing: watch out for rustling jackets, zippers that make noise.
volunteerHowItWorks.tip6: Sun: prevent your own shadow with the stick, film a bit more to the side.
volunteerHowItWorks.tip7: Turn very slowly if you want to show a direction, against your feeling; too slowly.
volunteerHowItWorks.tip8: Stay on the paths in principle (a little wandering is allowed).

agreement.title: General Terms and Conditions Virtual Walking

article1.title: Article 1 â€“ Definitions
article1.point1: Virtual Walking, located in Lemelerveld, Chamber of Commerce number 85578509, is referred to as the service provider in these general terms and conditions.
article1.point2: The counterparty is referred to as the customer in these general terms and conditions.
article1.point3: Agreement means the agreement whereby the customer gains access to the Virtual Walking digital platform and/or the associated services and products in exchange for payment of a fee.

article2.title: Article 2 â€“ Applicability
article2.point1: These terms and conditions apply to all quotes, subscriptions, deliveries of (digital) services and products, agreements and invoices from the service provider, unless explicitly agreed otherwise in writing.
article2.point2: These terms and conditions also apply to third parties engaged by the service provider.
article2.point3: The most recently sent version of these terms and conditions always applies.
article2.point4: The customer's general terms and conditions are expressly rejected.
article2.point5: If provisions prove to be wholly or partially invalid, the remainder remains in force.

article3.title: Article 3 â€“ Offer and subscriptions
article3.point1: Quotes or offers are valid for 21 calendar days, unless stated otherwise.
article3.point2: The service provider cannot be bound to an offer if there is an obvious mistake or error.
article3.point3: With a Virtual Walking subscription, the customer gets unlimited access to the nature walk videos of the platform.
article3.point4: The membership takes effect immediately at the time of subscription.
article3.point5: To terminate a monthly membership, a notice period of one month applies.
article3.point6: To terminate a 12-month membership, a notice period of three months applies before the end date of the membership.
article3.point7: Without timely cancellation, a membership is automatically converted to an indefinite-term membership after the end of the first period. The collection of costs then remains equal to the period for which the membership was originally entered into.
article3.point8: After conversion to an indefinite-term membership, a notice period of one month applies from the day that Virtual Walking received the cancellation.

article4.title: Article 4 â€“ Rates and payments
article4.point1: Rates for subscriptions or individual purchases are clearly stated including VAT.
article4.point2: Payment is made in advance via the payment methods offered by the service provider.
article4.point3: Automatic direct debit or payment also takes place with automatic renewal of a subscription.
article4.point4: The service provider reserves the right to change rates annually or in the interim. Customers will be notified of this in a timely manner.
article4.point5: If payment is not made, access to the platform may be suspended.

article5.title: Article 5 â€“ Use and access
article5.point1: After payment, the customer gains access to the Virtual Walking digital platform and the associated content.
article5.point2: It is not permitted to share login credentials with third parties.
article5.point3: Access may be temporarily interrupted due to maintenance or technical failures. The service provider strives for good availability but cannot guarantee this.

article6.title: Article 6 â€“ Right of withdrawal
article6.point1: For digital products and subscriptions, once the customer has gained access, the customer waives the statutory right of withdrawal.
article6.point2: By placing an order, the customer expressly agrees to this.

article7.title: Article 7 â€“ Intellectual property
article7.point1: All videos, images, texts and other materials on the platform remain the property of the service provider, unless stated otherwise.
article7.point2: The customer is not permitted to copy, distribute, make public or use these materials commercially without written permission.
article7.point3: Violation of these provisions may result in termination of access and a claim for damages.

article8.title: Article 8 â€“ Liability
article8.point1: The service provider is not liable for malfunctions or unavailability of the platform, unless there is intent or gross negligence.
article8.point2: The service provider is not liable for damage that arises from incorrect use of the platform by the customer.
article8.point3: If the service provider is liable, the compensation will never exceed the amount of the relevant subscription or purchase.

article9.title: Article 9 â€“ Privacy and data
article9.point1: The service provider processes personal data in accordance with applicable privacy legislation.
article9.point2: Customer is responsible for correctly providing and maintaining personal data required for access and billing.

article10.title: Article 10 â€“ Duration and termination
article10.point1: Cancellation of the membership can be done in writing, by telephone or by e-mail via Virtual Walking's customer service:
article10.point2: Cancellations are always confirmed by e-mail.
article10.point3: When canceling, always mention the e-mail address associated with the Virtual Walking account.
article10.point4: No refund will be given for early termination or non-use.

article11.title: Article 11 â€“ Force majeure
article11.point1: In case of force majeure (such as technical failures beyond the service provider's control, natural disasters, illness or government measures), the service provider may temporarily interrupt delivery.
article11.point2: In the event of force majeure lasting longer than 30 days, both parties have the right to terminate the agreement.

article12.title: Article 12 â€“ Complaints
article12.point1: Complaints about invoices or services must be submitted in writing and with reasons within 7 calendar days.
article12.point2: The service provider aims to process complaints within 5 working days.

article13.title: Article 13 â€“ Disputes
article13.point1: Dutch law applies to these terms and conditions.
article13.point2: Disputes are first attempted to be resolved through mutual consultation.
article13.point3: If this is not successful, disputes will be submitted to the competent court in the district where the service provider is located.

disclaimer.title: Virtual Walking Disclaimer
disclaimer.paragraph1: Despite the constant care and attention that Virtual Walking devotes to the composition and content of the platform and the associated videos, it is possible that the information provided is incomplete or incorrect. However, errors cannot always be prevented.
disclaimer.paragraph2: Claims and opinions expressed in videos, articles or other material on the platform are those of the creator(s) and not necessarily those of Virtual Walking as an organization. Virtual Walking cannot guarantee that the information and content on the platform is suitable in all cases for the purpose for which the user consults it. All information, products and services are offered in the state in which they actually are, without any (implicit) guarantee or warranty regarding their suitability for a specific purpose.
disclaimer.paragraph3: Virtual Walking excludes all liability for direct or indirect damage, of whatever nature, resulting from or in any way related to the use of the platform, the videos or other information made available via the platform.
disclaimer.paragraph4: Virtual Walking will make efforts to maximize the availability of the platform and to resolve any malfunctions as quickly as possible. Nevertheless, Virtual Walking is not liable for direct or indirect damage resulting from the temporary unavailability of the platform or parts thereof.

copyright.title: Copyright
copyright.paragraph1: All videos, images, texts and other materials on the Virtual Walking platform are protected by copyright and owned by Virtual Walking, unless stated otherwise. Visitors and users are expressly prohibited from copying, distributing, making public or using these materials commercially without prior written permission.
copyright.paragraph2: When users submit material (such as comments or suggestions) for publication on the platform, Virtual Walking has the right to edit, shorten or not place this material. Users must ensure that submitted material does not infringe on the rights of third parties (including copyrights) and does not constitute unlawful conduct towards third parties. Users themselves are liable for any damage resulting from this.
